title: Re: Very helpful practice
body:
I would highly recommned Shelley Manor, I have been a patient for some years, and if I'm moving, it's now at the point where I try to stay within the catchment area rather than starting all over with another GP. Highly rated staff, helpful and considerate.


I've been with the practice for some years now, aside from the teething issues when the practices were merging, which is understandable as most of any difficulties were during that transitional period, training staff etc. Other than that, 5* surgery, docturs, nurses, resception and office staff.
Many thanks to all of you!

author: AliceK21
title: Thank you to the birth centre
body:
I wanted to say thank you to Birth Centre, Lucina team (Alice, Nadia, Lulu) and Triage(especially Rebecca) - you guys are amazing and I really appreciate your support and kindness all the way through my pregnancy.  
I was comfortable to talk about my concerns and issues during pregnancy with Alice - my professional midwife:) I am also lucky to have Alice, Nadia and Lulu on the labour. That made huge different in terms of my feeling - so much comfortable to have someone you know when you are nervous and scared on your birth. Only what I can complain to Croydon University Hospital is that the facilities and equipment is completely lacking - broken cabinets in the labour room, cold air coming through closed windows in post-labour room(poor insulation) They are exceptionally hard working and professional on their job and they deserve to be provided with adequate facilities to do the job.

author: rhinory67
title: Very professional service
body: Very professional service, the staff very helpful and friendly, excellent facilities made to feel comfortable in a difficult situation, easy and quick. Very happy with visit.

author: Cla22
title: Awaiting appointment
body: My mum has been unwell. GP referred for ops scope as an emergency, still not done. Scope can only be done after a gastro appointment I called the GP all have been requested as urgent I called the gasto departments who have it as urgent and that it has been passed to appointments. I called them and told an appointment would be in a few weeks. This has now been months and not heard a thing. Utter shocking service, just hoping there's not something sinister going on that’s been left untreated. Which with the symptoms I worry it could well be.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Truth talker
title: Constant undiagnosed testicular pain
body:
Iv suffered from severe testicular pain for about 9 months now . Iv had many tests done including physical examinations, blood & urine tests . 2 ultrasounds and more. The only thing that has been found is two 5mm cysts in my scrotum and the urologist doctor at pilgrim hospital dismissed them as not being the source of the pain and then simply brushed me off and sent me to pain management . Upon speaking to pain management they was shocked that I was sent there because normally people are there when surgery has failed to work and nobody has even attempted to sort out my cysts yet by surgery so I’m in the process of getting a second opinion elsewhere instead and hopefully they will care for me better than the urology department at Pilgrim hospital .  
However when I went to the A&E department yesterday for what turned out to be a urinary tract infection (probably caused by the cysts in my scrotum becoming inflamed as it’s been 9 months in severe pain) the staff was brilliant. The doctor I saw was swift and good to deal with me so I could go back home.

author: Briandoc
title: Access to urgent CT scan
body:
I have been coughing up blood on and off for some months, I eventually contacted my GP about 6 weeks ago and they said they would refer me for an urgent CT scan at Wishaw hospital, as it may be lung cancer.  
I was advised that I should get the scan within the week, and that if I hadn’t had it in 2 weeks I should get back in touch ... I waited 3 weeks and phoned back, the GP then phoned the hospital and phoned me back, most apologetic but there is a 22 week waiting list ...  
It seemed absurd that patients who may have serious illness have to wait 22 weeks for a scan, 22 weeks for a potential cancer to grow and spread ...  
I contacted my local MSP, who contacted the hospital on my behalf, only to be told that GP cannot refer a patient for a CT scan. I have been referred to respiratory department and I will get an appointment with them at some point in the future and they will refer me if they think it is suitable for a CT scan.  
Maybe it would be best for people in my situation to go straight to A and E, maybe save the 22 week waiting list and save your life.

author: deaconw21
title: Zero tolerance policy
body:
I've been in the cardiology dept for approx 27 hours. I have experienced nothing but kindness, care, and concern from RCHT staff. However, I am totally shocked at the level of abuse the staff has to endure, and I've only been here 27 hrs!!!  
It's a disgrace. Why doesn't the hospital you get behind your heroes and implement a zero tolerance policy?  
No one should have to put up with what I have witnessed since my admission.

title: Poor mental health support
body:
I booked to meet GP to discuss three issues, two mental one physical.

Physical was okay.

Mental was simply a self referral, second mental was not even discussed.

Not impressed.

title: Excellent service
body: We called in to enquire about flu jab arrangements and were both given the jab straightaway in a most efficient manner. Everyone was helpful and friendly throughout.

title: Flu jab.
body: Very very well organised. No waiting. Very friendly. Perfect. Congratulations to every one involvedfrom stewards nurses staff. Thanl you.

title: Wonderful experience at Spamedica, Poole, Dorset
body:
Had first cataract removed at Spamedica, Poole on 16th September, 2021.
Cannot praise staff highly enough for my treatment. Everyone was so professional, kind and reassuring from the moment I entered the clinic. From the Porter and Receptionist, the Surgeon and all the Medical staff, the Optometrist and the Manager, I felt well- cared for and informed. Thank you.

title: Outstanding dental department
body:
Dr in this department are kind considerate knowledgeable understanding patient and fantastic
Been there three this year with concerns they examined me and put my mind at test completely offered additional support when they could see I was struggling

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Absolutely Brilliant Team
body: I would just like to say a huge thank you to the team who carried out my procedure last week. I felt very well looked after and well informed about what was happening. The gynaecologist was very caring and made me feel very comfortable. The nursing assistant was very cheerful, supportive and chatty and helped to put me at ease. Having visited the gynae department several times in the last few years I truly do believe that it deserves great praise as all of the staff are always so professional and caring. Thank you for making my experience, both today and previously, such a positive one and for always taking the time to care.

title: Brilliant GP Practice
body: Brilliant service from the GP, always their to take the time out and listen to the problem. Easy to make an appointment with friendly reception staff.

title: Fantastic flu jab clinic today
body: Only recently joined this practice, but very impressed with the quick, professional and friendly service today. Went for my flu jab, and was out in just a matter of minutes. Good communication before and during the appointment. Also had a smear test in the summer and thought the nurse was excellent.

title: Simple and Effective
body: The surgery was organised and as covid secure as it can be. The doctor was efficient and was able to diagnose the issue quickly and professionally. She offered the treatment and follow-up there and then for something which I have had for three years. (And far better than a trip to Watford General)

title: Outstanding service
body: Sent to eye unit from St Peters on Sunday 19-9-21 & saw on call doctor at 1.30pm in ophthalmology. He carried out extensive test to my eyes followed up by getting colleague to photograph & scan my eyes just to make sure he hadn't missed anything. He was extremely thorough in his examination & I was very confident in his explanation  of my condition. Very dedicated member of staff.

title: Quick and efficient
body: Rang to arrange for a telephone consultation for my son expecting a call back in a day or two. The receptionist went off and spoke to the GP and came back asking me to bring him in within half an hour. I didn't expect a telephone call back so quick never mind an actual fact to face appointment. Just shows they look at each case and prioritise and in his case thought it was urgent case. Luckily it was good news once he had been seen. Thanks to the GP's and reception staff for being so efficient especially during these difficult times.  You are all doing a wonderful job and are much appreciated.

title: So far today a fair experience
body:
I tried this weekend to make an e-consult but it seems the practice computer has the weekends off as you can’t do it over the weekend!!
Given the significant concerns about my condition I phoned this morning, expecting (given previous experiences my wife and I have had this year) long delays for a receptionist to answer.
I was extremely pleasantly surprised when after 5mins the phone was answered.  The male receptionist was excellent and told me a Doctor will call today and probably require a face to face appointment.
This male receptionist also assisted with my wife a few weeks ago and she praised his efficiency and customer service.  More people like this please.
Limes surgery need to get back to pre-Covid practices.

title: Excellent practice
body: My experiences with St Paul’s surgery have been exceptional despite immense pressure of the pandemic. The reception staff are friendly and incredibly helpful on the phone. I’ve had prompt and appropriate call backs from a GP the same day and excellent clinical care. One GP went out of their way in the evening to help me following problems in early pregnancy. I can’t fault the St Paul’s team and am so grateful they are our local GP.

title: Great practice
body: Always found this practice to be efficient and friendly and recommend to anybody. We moved into the area nearly 2 years ago and by the time we needed to use the services of the practice the pandemic had struck and though we reduced our visits for minor problems due to this, we have always felt the practice was serving our needs, sometimes extremely quickly, possibly due to other people reducing demand on services like we had.

author: Glasan
title: Comprehensive eye examination
body:
Professional service and comprehensive eye examination at the optometry/ophthalmology service.  
Special thanks to Lea, Stephanie and Paddy for their care and attention.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Michael T
title: The nurse helping made all the difference
body: I had a call with with my mother in the Royal Victoria on her 92nd birthday. The Zoom meeting was perfect, the organisation was very professional. Especially having a person there to help, as my mother is not bad of 92 but she can "press the wrong button"! The nurse helping made all the difference, a three-way conversation kept things going. This was the first time I have been able to see her for 11 months as I am in England and with the various lock-downs. Thank you all, greatly appreciated.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Dubs
title: Nice to be able to chat
body:
Hello I felt  this was such a positive experience 
This not having family present Is so detrimental to folk especially  frail elderly 
And more so those with dementia 
It was so nice to be able to chat with my aunt with my mum ( we have recently lost our dear dad )
 All Staff so lovely so helpful 
Several times lost sound perhaps my aunt pressed something but straight away staff sorted it 
Thank you so much 
You are  all doing a fantastic job in these devastating times

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: camillecrozat
title: Talkative and understanding staff
body:
Went to the walk in covid vaccination clinic at the St. andrews hospital today and was very pleased with my experience there.  
The staff both at reception, the nurses and the person giving me the short were very friendly, talkative and understanding. I have no complaints, it was perfect thank you!

author: RaspberryBeret
title: Staff were so gentle and caring
body: Although the procedure isn’t pleasant it wasn’t sore. The nursing staff and Dr put me at ease, and were so gentle and caring. They explained what was going to happen and then as it happened so there were no surprises. 5 star treatment, well done and thank you, you guys were amazing!!

author: julynz77
title: Lack of empathy and understanding
body: Lack of empathy, no understanding and I would hate to say in my experience lacking in knowledge. Missed my diagnosis 6 months ago. Gave me some antibiotics and nystatin for my pelvic pain which I still feel. I was elsewhere diagnosed with polyps in my womb. When I presented the surgery with this diagnosis I was told they need a translation of findings as I had received the diagnosis abroad, and the doctor told me they don't call them polyps here. I feel I was treated with disrespect and rudeness and lost all trust in this surgery. After 6 months of pain, fear and tears I have decided to leave this surgery because I believe my life depends on it.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Brilliant Practice
body: I had to arrange a blood test recently for my mother and wanted to obtain a prescription quickly. This was arranged the same day without any delay.

title: Nhs 111
body: Called the 111 line at 7pm for my 1 and a half year old got told they would call back in 2 hours, it’s not been 16 hours later and still no phone call!!!!

title: Seamless
body:
Like so many others we turned up for our flu jabs in the walk through clinic. We were in and out in minutes with the absolute minimum of fuss but maximum organisation and professionalism.
Well Done!

title: Debenham Ward
body: 18/9/21 the male nurse and HCA running A bay on this day while short staffed need to be commended for their professional care and attentive listening skills when asked to clarify pending care requirements of my son. He is blind, a diabetic and transplant patient and would like them commended for supporting and understanding his personal care requirements. They were the only staff on that end that day and took things in their stride they are a credit to their profession and to the reputation of their Ward. We were blessed that they endeavoured to resolve pending procedures that need doing. Well done both of you. Thank you Denise & Marc

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

author: TPPcglbrum
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: She was always there when I needed help
body:
I’ve just finished getting support from you and I’m doing really well and it feels great. I want to make sure that my worker, Shaheen, gets the credit she deserves for the support she has given me.  
  
Whilst I was getting support from your service, she was always there when I needed help. I felt like I could tell her anything, and she would be there pushing me forwards. This was exactly what I needed, and I don’t think I would have made it if it wasn’t for her.  
  
I have no doubt she has and will do the same for others. She has been absolutely amazing.

author: hippoqz84
title: Flu vaccine invitation from the elves and fairies
body:
Received an invitation for the flu clinic for my 27 month old toddler. The invite was from the elves and fairies at the Nightingale practice.  
On arrival we was greeted by an elf who took temperatures and was directed inside to the fairies who was doing their vaccination in the form of bubbles.  
The Waiting area was decorated with unicorn balloons and very welcoming, resembled more of a party room.  
The fairy who gave my son his bubbles was Cheerful and remained in character.  
It was a very pleasant and successful trip and would definitely recommend something like this again. My son left happy and content.

title: Not happy GP appointments procedure!
body: I arranged an appointment for a doctor using the rules set out by the surgery of phoning the surgery after 8am, I did this and I was told a doctor would phone me. I was arranging an appointment for my mother who has serious health issues. Instead of a doctor phoning I received a phone call from a nurse and spent 10mins justifying why I needed to see a Doctor as I had arranged, Instead I got into a lengthy discussion as to why I needed to see a doctor. It is immensely hard just getting to see or even chat to a doctor over the phone with this surgery. Generally the advice given when speaking with anyone other than a GP is go to the chemist and get something over the counter, that's not the advice you expect from a GP unless it's a minor aliment. Unfortunately it's not that easy when you have mother with serious health issues. The service for "appointments" at present is poor. It's not just a matter of battling psychologically one's illnesses with this surgery, it's also a battle to get to see or communicate with GP to even discuss your illnesses. I'm not happy with how this practice is currently organising GP appointments, something needs to done differently.

author: Neil19831
title: Ending up in hospital while on holiday
body:
I am currently on holiday and ended up in hospital,  
The staff at the hospital were very kind and caring and looked after me very well so they made me feel happy while in hospital

author: petemurry
title: kidney disease
body:
Back in June/July of 2019 I was admitted to ward 22 and in the end was diagnosed with MPGN a kidney disease which I am still dealing with. I could not have been in safer hands the staff were so kind and then at the beginning of Dec 2019 was rushed back into the Victoria hospital thinking it was my kidney's again, only for to find out that my temp reached 41.9 and could not breathe properly.  
I was on oxygen and they were fighting to get my temp down with fans and ice packs which after a week it worked and I was better but now I just wonder whether it was actually covid 19 because it was all the same symptoms of covid what does anybody think? Just a thought maybe someone at the hospital could look into it and let me know  
Thank you for letting me tell my story

author: Angels1
title: The dedication of staff is inspiring
body:
I don’t know how to start but I’ll give it a go.  
After contracting COVID-19 I found it overwhelming to see the dedication of all the staff working under extremely difficult conditions saving people’s lives and giving the usual first class care.  
How they deal with patients is inspiring to say the least.  
I like many others wouldn’t be here today without the their dedications and care, Angels

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

author: gcpc
title: My dad had a fall & waited 11 hours for an ambulance
body:
My 89yr old dad (dementia, double incontinence) had a fall & waited 11 hours for an ambulance  
My dad (89yrs old, lives alone, has Alzheimer's disease, doubly incontinent) fell in his house (at approx 6:30pm).  
His carer (who visits him at teatime each day for 1 hr) was unable to lift him. She phoned 999 for assistance. She informed me of my dad's fall. I live over 100 miles away so was unable to quickly respond. The carer and I were in regular contact throughout the evening. I called 999 @ 10pm to chase up the ambulance. As my dad was conscious and not bleeding, he was classed as a low priority, although he is a vulnerable individual.  
The ambulance arrived @ 5:30am, 11 hours after the initial 999 call. This waiting time is completely unacceptable for anyone, let alone a 89 year old man with dementia. I would like to know 1) how I can progress this information to ensure it does not happen to anyone else and 2) whether the 11 hour wait time is outside of your Service Level Agreement.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Pegaso740
title: Lack of support from the Dermatology Department.
body:
I feel totally let down by the whole NHS system, my face is so damaged I don't want to go out, let alone not being able to as I cannot find an SPF to stop burning and swelling.  
I was prescribed Potent steroid creams with a warning not to go out, even on cloudy days without a strong SPF cover. My facial skin is severely damaged, I requested a recommendation for an SPF as I can only purchase cover from the make up department, nothing over the counter for damaged skin. I was told there was nothing Dermatology could recommend. Surely this is not okay when the prescribed creams are so strong. I've had severe eczema for 18 months, I have only been prescribed steroid creams leaving my face in urgent need of SPF cover to go outside in any temperature. I have purchased 6 different over the counter SPF brands, all aggravate my skin and make the itching and redness worse.  
I am at a complete loss as to how I can protect my skin when I go out. If I do not cover my face swells. I am in a no win situation. At my age I need to be able to do my 30 minutes of exercise/10,000 steps daily to keep myself mobile, active and independent

author: browserkn47
title: My recent visit to A and E (stepping Hill)
body:
I was sat in the garden finishing a bottle of beer. The last mouthful felt strange and I thought I had swallowed a piece of glass at the bottom of the bottle. Playing it safe I had no choice to vomit up what ever it was. It was a wasp. Whilst in my throat it decided to sting me. My throat starting to close. I took an antihistamine and drove to A and E at Stepping Hill Hospital  
it is quite concerning feeling your throat closing and your voice changing. I have to say from the start to the finish all the staff were extremely professional and efficient. I am very grateful for the care I received. Even though they were extremely busy, they couldn’t do enough to help me. Thank you very much.

author: kilowm65
title: Mistreated at Wharnfield .
body:
Came for induction monday, staff very friendly, took me to labour ward where staff were friendly and knowledgeable. After my c section was brought back to wharnfield ward around 13 h30 staff on duty helped as I couldn't move my legs after c section .  
Next day all was well during the day, came night shift staff where only asking other patients do they need help not me, I ignored it. when charging bed they will charge for everyone not me. mind you I'm in pain as well, cant stand or walk well, they didn't even provide bed sheets, I had to ask for them, respond was they would bring it but never returned. I ended up asking the doctor who came to see my son for bed sheet thus when I was handed it.  
Buzzed for pain killers as no one bothered to offer will be given after any hour if, I was luck enough that time, buzzed at 00h00 for pain killers support worker will come switch off the buzzer and say your midwife will come never came, went to reception for pain killers they said midwife will come until they around 6 comes with one tablet and say they will give you more at 8 am finished their shift.  
Thinking its new shift things will change - worsens. I asked for baby milk noone comes back. Pain killers, no midwife at that time i am in pain, the whole day given painkillers twice cause all the staff will be saying we will tell your midwife to come see you.  
Staff at wharfield treated me as a patient as if I was mental disturbed. It felt like prison in this ward, I ask noone comes back to me, I felt I had to be following them around to get attention from them .

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

title: Always helpful
body: I have to phone surgery regularly to re arrange or organise appointments for my mum as she gets very confused with her appointments . I always find the receptionist so helpful and compassionate . The doctors also are lovely and phone me back quickly when I need advice

title: Great hospital
body: Having just celebrated my birthday I believe I literally owe my life and health to the expertise and wonderful staff at Medway Maritime Hospital. I was first admitted in April 2020 with breathing difficulties caused by Covid that I had contracted through my work. After their brilliant work and expertise I was able to return home. However by December I was again unwell and ended up being admitted on one of their busiest nights. I was told at one point there were 14 ambulances waiting with patients at A & E. Although I was unaware of the pressure the hospital must have been under as I was treated like I was the most important person there by everyone I met! I spent nearly a week as an inpatient at a time right before Christmas when we were suddenly plunged into level 4 lockdown. Again everyone I came into contact with was cheerful and doing their best to give everyone the best treatment they could. I finally came home a few days before Christmas. While in hospital I had an ultra sound and a CT scan both departments couldn't do enough to help. When I came home I needed to go back for an mri scan and wasn't expecting to hear anything with Covid, the holiday and New year. Again I was amazed when my appointment arrived without delay and again the department staff were wonderful. Following this scan the surgeon called me within days with the result and news that I would require surgery, he was so apologetic when explaining that due to Covid the wait would be until the end of the year. Then in May I suddenly got a call to tell me my operation was scheduled for a couple of weeks time! I then attended the various pre op clinics and again staff were friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Finally I had my operation at the Sunderland day unit and thanks to the skill of my surgeon and the staff in the unit I returned home the same day and have made a great recovery. I wanted to take this opportunity to say that my experience of this hospital has been outstanding and words cannot express how grateful I am to everyone who made it possible for me to see this birthday.

author: raincd35
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Midwives are kind, caring & personable
body:
My maternity stay has been nothing but excellent. All the midwives are excellent and supportive. I could not pick one in particular as they were all lovely - kind, caring and very personable.  
The ward itself is clean and all the available facilities are good . I cannot think of anything which could be improved!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: No call back after 12 hours
body:
Absolutely horrified. Rang at 2pm to be told i will receive call back within 6 hours.
Rang back 8.15pm took 35 minutes to get connected. Re-did assessment, call handler also rang through to out of hours service to be told i would receive call within hour maybe a slight delay.
12 hours later still no call

author: moondm96
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Maternity experience has been 100%
body:
My time in maternity has been dead on - 100%. All the midwives are really friendly and helpful.  
I would like to particularly mention the midwife Emma who has been absolutely excellent. All the midwives have been brilliant, but Emma has been particularly good. The ward itself has also been great. I cannot think of anything which could be improved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Extremely helpful and great practice. Thank you!!…
body:
I was extremely pleased with the level of service I received during my recent visit. The availability of appointments during out of work hours, in the evenings and over the weekends is most welcome for people in fulltime employment such as myself. Pearl Medical Centre is very well managed and I am grateful for their invites and reminders for my annual health reviews.

 Highly experienced, attentive, and compassionate staff. Thank you for taking such good care of me. God bless you all.

title: Terrible
body: I have filled out an online consult as they won't speak to you if you ring them. They have to ring you back. I have been waiting nearly a week for them to ring me back regarding my 1 year old daughter, Following the health visitor instructions. The fact they haven't rang back or been in touch for a pediatric concern is terrible. I just don't understand how a practice is running so badly. Not the first bad experience with this practice.

title: No hope!
body: After failing to get a hosp app because of inadequate clinical input from the GP I am told by receptionist that the problem will be sorted and I will be phoned back ……so a week later..no call back….impossible to get through to surgery by phone ….. can anyone tell me the point of this surgery….because I can’t actually find any good points!!!!

title: Horrific receptionist
body: The female receptionist is the most abrupt and rude person I have ever had an encounter with, is incredible incompetent at her job, and should not be working face to face with the public. This is not the first time me or friends have had the pleasure of being served by her incredible manner. Multiple times the reception have also told me to come back at 17:30 to pick a prescription up, when arriving to be told by the pharmacy it, has not even been sent over to them yet. Lack of care and compassion from this medical centre, should be shut down.

title: Unable to contact
body: I got in telephone queue for appointments only to be disconnected when I was down to 2. Try to book online appointment only to be told to call, no wander people are going straight to A & E. This service is appalling especially when you have a potential serious problem.

title: Doctors are good Reception and surgery manager…
body: Trying to get details changed at the surgery is a nightmare. The reception and surgery manager just try and get you off their books. No empathy or understanding of circumstance and would not allow you to speak to doctors. Going very downhill!

title: Unacceptable availability
body: This surgery is almost impossible to reach. they do not enable their phone system even though it says it can be used from 0830. Getting an appointment is given the following response "Sorry, but your call cannot be completed at present". it is not 0907 and I have been trying to get through for 40 minutes.

title: Flu jab
body: I had my flu jab yesterday morning - it all went very smoothly and I was in and out in about 5 minutes. It was really well organised - nice to see so many volunteers - well done Fordingbridge 👍👏

title: Amazingly well organised flu & pneumonia jab…
body: The surgery got in touch with us by text message to book in our flu jabs.  It was so easy to book these by clicking on the links given.  When we turned up there were five queues where different health professionals were giving the vaccines to people one after the other.  I asked and was told they would be vaccinating 500 people on the Saturday morning when we turned up.  Amazingly well organised, so quick to get us in and out, job done so professionally!

title: Booking an appointment is a shambles
body:
Since moving to Stone I have been shocked at just how poor a practice can be. The doctors/nurses themselves are fine, but the way it is managed it ridiculous. Pre covid it was hard to book an appointment, the phone was never answered, now it is next to impossible.

Now you have to call first thing, and hope that it is not engaged meaning around 80+ calls to get through, which when your working is hard to manage. If you call after lunch there's no way to book an appointment they tell you you have to call in the morning!? Why can't I just book one now, even for a few days/weeks time?!

Today I have been told I have to use their new online system which is a lot worse than the old patient access one they had (which for some reason they binned off a while ago). After booking, I got a text saying "You will receive a text or phone call within 2 working days"....2 days!?!!? There's no time given when this response will be, or what the response will be, is that an appointment to speak to the doctor? I have no idea. Whilst a lot of the time I can answer my phone whilst working, that is not always the case, I have meetings, I have to be out on site, why can't they give me a time so I can ensure I am free, rather than me having to hope I am available to answer.

I appreciate I may have to wait for an appointment, but I should be able to book one at a suitable time even if it is days in the future. Past surgeries I have always been able to book an appointment either via phone or online instantly and I would then at least know I what time and when I will be seen/spoken to.

Don't be fooled, this practice was terrible before Covid, it is just even worse now and I suspect they will continue to use Covid as an excuse for the foreseeable future.

title: Prompt and friendly treatment
body:
I attended the walk in centre on Saturday morning. There were about 5 people in front of me. The staff were all very pleasant and friendly. I was triaged very quickly and had blood pressure etc checked. 

I was called in by the nurse about 30 minutes later and examined very thoroughly. I was treated with respect and it was all COVID safe. 

I was treated and given a prescription. My condition was explained to me and was told what to do if my condition deteriorated.

I would definitely recommend the walk-in centre.

Thank you.

title: Impossible to contact and doesn't keep their…
body: I haven't actually succeed in visiting the surgery. The online way to interact with them are through phone. the lines here are ( perhaps not surprisingly) outrageous. Once I did manage to book an appointment  I show up only for them to have not registered the appointment - back to the phone que where ( after 20 minutes) they then refuse options for the appointment beyond one day which is impossible for me workwise. Terrible service and you get the impression that they are working specifically to avoid actually helping patients.

title: Dissappointing
body: Never answer the phone - 136 calls to be on hold for 45 mins to be told can't have face to face with Doctor despite recurring issues.  Looking to move.

title: poor service
body: i have been suffering everyday with sickness and severe stomach pain some days i cant even get off the toilet i am getting no care from my gp i waited 2 weeks for a phone app i was rang 2 hours late and he was rushing me i dont know the doctor who rang he rushed me off the phone didnt want to listen and now i cant even ring the surgery for another appointment its always engaged how frustrating i am 32 and suffering daily who can i turn to if my gp hasnt enough time

title: Awful
body: The clinic is a disgrace. Every time myself or my partner call to make an appointment we are on hold for sometimes up to an hour to then be told there are no appointments left. On the rare occasion there are appointments left the receptionist decides our issue is not an emergency and therefore we can not make an appointment. My partner suffers with very bad eczema which he needs steroid treatments for which can not be gotten at the pharmacy. He has to have a prescription from a doctor. If he doesn't have this, it can get very bad and spread across his entire body. When it's this bad, he is unable to work as he can barely move from the pain. How can a receptionist deem this as a non emergency? On another occasion I had a ear infection and was in agony for a number of days before trying to get an appointment. I had gone to the pharmacy first, but they advised they are unable to give over the counter products for this and that I would need to see a doctor. When contacting the GP they tell me they won't see me for an ear infection and that I need to go to the pharmacy, even though I  had already done this. In the end I had to call 111 who advised me to go to A&E. The doctor in A&E was appalled that the receptionist wouldn't give me an appointment as I needed medication which could not be gotten without a prescription.  There are many more instances but are more private and I would not be comfortable disclosing on a public forum. I think the Receptionists require more training as they have very poor customer service skills and deem everything as a non emergency.

title: Great Doctors, Shocking reception and…
body: The Doctors here are an absolute god send, they are extremely highly skilled and efficient. The Doctors are welcoming and comforting and work hard to understand their patients and resolve things. The main problem with this practice is reception. I would not recommend this practice based on the fact it can take up to 21 calls in hour to actual get it to ring through. The others all just get cut off instantly. There is no phone queue nothing. Which is poor. An hour later obviously there are no appointments left. I have three cysts now all from a medication that my GP told me just call back and we will swap it back straight away and not to worry... These cysts are painful for reception to explain the next available appointment is 17th October or I can keep calling every day... just to be cut off everyday. I explained that this is poor as it just cuts off and was told that I can go find another GP practice if I don't like this one. Which is very hard as the good ones have waiting lists. The GPs and Nurses are amazing... Can't fault them at all. Shame the reception system doesn't work well. Most of the receptionist are actually very  polite and kind... It is just the poor fact that you can never get through to them.

author: intensityht36
title: Incredibly friendly & supportive midwives
body:
My Daisy Hill maternity experience has been fine - all good. The staff have all been incredibly friendly and supportive of all my needs. I would especially like to mention Tracey who has been absolutely fantastic.  
My only source of improvement, and I am clutching at straws when I say this, is that the environment is quite noisy, and a private room would be nice.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Ludicrous appointment system not fit for purpose
body: I have just registered with this practice because the GPs seem to get good reviews. On Friday I received a text asking me to make an appointment to discuss a letter the practice had received. When I attended reception to deliver a scan report I was told curtly that it was only possible to book an appointment by telephone from 8 a.m. I speed-dialled the surgery instantly after the 8 a.m. time pips on radio 4 this morning only to find that the line was already engaged! I re-dialled every minute for 30 minutes before finding myself 8th in the queue. After a further 5 minutes a very pleasant receptionist answered only to tell me that there were no more appointments! This system is absurd and the GPs and practice manager need to improve it. Sooner or later, a patient will suffer serious health consequences because they have been unable to make an appointment or have given up trying. (At my previous surgery - which I left very reluctantly because of a change of address - I never had difficulty in making an appointment.)

title: impossible to get appointments, getting bad
body:
All family been registered here for 10 years.
Initially good service. Gradually got worse.
Post pandemic has become a joke.
They don't do face to face appointments even now that all restrictions have been lifted.
What is worse is that it's impossible to get appointments.
You email the surgery for an appointment and they say they don't book appointments by email.
You go to the "empty" surgery and reception say they only book appointments over the phone.
You call, the phone is dead. Tried calling for days and days and the phone is or busy or dead (which makes me wonder if they just get disconnected on purpose or due to lack of staff). However the phone always works every day between 1-2 BUT an answering machine says they don't take calls as do training between 1-2 each day.
Went back to an "empty surgery" to complain and show phones don't get answered and receptionist said "sorry just try again, nothing they can do". 
In the meantime my child is sick, will not receive the care needed and guess the only other option is A&E. 
We used to be able to book appointments in person but now it's impossible.
And looks to me they channel you to calls which then don't get answered.
This surgery is going downhill over the last few years. Would not recommend.

title: Great Practice
body:
On Friday 10th September I rang the surgery as I wanted some advice regarding back pain I had been suffering with for a few days. The answer phone informed me that I was first in the queue. I left a message requesting that the physiotherapist could give me a call back, which she duly did within the hour. She gave me advice and told me to ring on the Monday if no improvement. I followed her advice and my back pain subsided within a few days. 
I rate this as excellent service from the NHS and more importantly from the staff and practitioners at Fleet Medical Centre. 
I also concur with the comments from patients regarding the excellent organisation of the flu clinics. I attended on the 11th Sept. with no queue and in and out within 5 minutes.
Fleet Medical Centre is working hard to meet patient needs in what is an extremely stressful time in the NHS, and deserve the support of it’s patients.

title: ABSOLUTELY poor front desk staff
body: you make an appointment for two week in advance. Its a telephone appointment. On the day of expected call they cancel. You are then back to stage one. You have to make the appointment again with another two week wait

title: Appointments Useless
body: I’ve tried to make an appointment for an annual review as they have requested I do via text message.  They are fully booked till October 11th and can’t offer an appointment after that time unless I call back. Wouldn’t be a problem but it’s 15-20 minute wait on hold just to be told there are no appointments.  Can’t book this type of appointment through the app either.  Apparently my time is not worth as much as theirs.

title: Excellent
body: First class care from first appointment to last, friendly very helpful staff would most definitely recommend us.

title: Gone Down Hill
body:
I have always thought highly and praised Cradley surgery in the past, and rarely try and see a doctor and have always been able to see one or had a phone consultation fairly easily. However today I tried to make an appointment and was told the earliest I can see or speak to a doctor is 8th October, so nearly 3 weeks time, I wasn't asked what the problem may be, I feel very let down by this, if it turns out to be serious then 3 weeks is totally un-acceptable. 

I also spoke to the hospital who told me to speak to my doctor so I am at a loss for words.

title: Excellent doctor
body: Just wanted to leave a review to say how much I appreciate the level of care I received in both my appointments. Best doctors I have seen, kind, unrushed and caring. I know they have been under intense pressure for the last couple of years in particular so I hugely appreciate it. Thank you

title: Unhelpful reception staff
body:
Went in this morning 20.09.2021 
Never had problems before the member of staff was rude & not helpful I went in twice today very I can’t be bothered attitude 
after trying to call with 25 in queue when I went in no one answering phone & one receptionist

title: very professional
body: The team at Light treatment Basford are friendly and very professional made me feel more like a person rather than a patient

title: NHS patient
body:
Can't fault the treatment I received.
Information about procedure given through out my stay. The staff on the ward were really nice and nothing was too much trouble. Would highly recommend Thornbury either as a NHS patient or private patient

title: Excellent service for giving flu jab.
body: Very smooth procedure for booking the appointment for flu jab & excellent organisation on the day when jab was given at the surgery.

title: Unacceptable service
body:
Rude receptionist long waiting time for an answer on the phone and cannot tell me when the next clinic is scheduled for cortisone injections to book in for one. This procedure was not even explained on speaking to a doctor during a telephone appointment.
Unacceptable service when I cannot use my arm and need the injection urgently.
Not sympathetic not helpful and unapologetic unsatisfactory customer service

title: Telephone System
body:
I was treated on 2nd September for removal of an impacted wisdom tooth. Firstly I wish to say that the whole experience was excellent. The staff were professional and caring and the surgical team excellent. The room on the ward was well appointed and comfortable.
However there was one problem. That is the telephone system.
In the days leading up to my admission I telephoned the Hospital on two occasions in need of urgent advice. An automated voice told me to leave a message and someone would get back to me. It did not happen and I am still waiting! Also I received a text telling me that the time of my procedure would be changed. That in itself was no problem - but I wanted to know when I could have a drink. The message said that if I had any queries to phone a certain number. When I did that several times, I was told that the number was not recognised.
These problems caused some anxiety that was totally unnecessary. I think the Hospital should review its telephone system and I would like to speak to someone about this.

title: Inaccessible
body: If you telephone the practice for urgent help they will not see you, unless you can obtain one of the very few, slots bookable on the day. Being quoted several weeks for a risky condition that should be seen and assessed quickly with the only alternative offered being phoning everyday to see if you can obtain a very, very rare spare slot  or referred to the 'hub' for a condition that the practice is responsible for managing, is unacceptable. What is worse is that the receptionist makes these decisions without reference to a doctor or nurse and gives random, contradictory, advice they are not qualified to. For example, I was, wrongly, told to attend A&E and also told to do something completely different in the same conversation.  In this situation I was not offered the opportunity to speak to a doctor or nurse and my illness and need was assessed solely by the receptionist.

title: Flu Vaccination
body: Very friendly nurses. Kind and caring towards my special needs Daughter. They chatted to her and put her at ease. Easy, well posted instructions where to go in the car park to have the vaccinations under the gazebos.

title: Outpatients Appointments Waiting Time
body: Have spent over 1 hour trying to amend an outpatient booking. I started at position 6 in the queue and 1 hour later, was in position 4. Are you telling me it takes an hour to move 2 places in the queue to change an appointment? That seems 'unlikely' at best. Really poor service and sadly, very common.

title: Very helpful staff
body: The staff is very helpful and very accommodating. I needed a medication quickly and a blood test. The team was able to arrange one for me in a matter of less than a day. Thanks you!!

title: Practice is OK but using online frustrating
body: Huge frustration with NHS app and can't find link to surgery app. NHS app says no appointments, phone surgery. Surgery says fill in online form. To do this, you have to go onto Internet and find their site. You do this and get told doctor will phone you. No-one phones. Tried LIVI but first online appointment was in 4 days! In pain so go to A&E. System is not fit for purpose. Eastwick Park practice itself would be fine if you could see someone.

title: Excellent Organization...
body: ...at the recently visited flu vaccination marquee. Well directed by volunteers, fast entry, quick jab, and fast exit.. all staff friendly and helpful: thanks to all involved!

title: Extreme Delays
body: Although the hearing test was very good. The wait now for hearing aid replacements is unacceptable. Unable to contact the department, the answer phone message is not relevant

title: Very disappointing
body:
I waited for about 40 minutes in a queue to report recurring chest pain and a telephone doctor's appointment was arranged.  The doctor did not call and when I reported this the following day the receptionist was quite unhelpful. She insisted that the doctor had called me as arranged, although my phone clearly showed that he had not. She then told me I would have to wait two weeks for another appointment. When I said that I thought two weeks was a bit excessive, she suggested I called 111.
The lady from 111 was very helpful - actually contacted the surgery and asked them to call me. By this time, less than an hour later, the soonest appointment on offer was three weeks away.
Within a few days I had suffered a heart attack and was admitted to hospital as an emergency.

title: Great visit to a covid positive ward.
body:
I have ticked the "dont know" depatmental box because there doesn't seem to be an A&E box. I was advised to go to A&E by a doctor on 111. Generally excellent service but I was taken by a nurse into a ward with covid positive patients [Majors]. I have Long Covid. This is NOT the same as Covid. I don't have covid. I was there for about 5 minutes when the senior nurse got me out of there with haste. She then berated the supervisor of the nurse who as far as I could see didn't seem that fussed. This was Friday 10th September 
I woke on Monday 13th with a sore throat and a cough. Not sure what that might be but have ordered a CPR test.

On Sunday 12th I returned for a CT scan and was told by telephone call to report [as soon as possible] to Team 1 [opposite the pharmacy]. We did this, arriving about 11am and explained that we were there for a CT scan with contrast and the receptionist said we were in the wrong place, we confirmed that we had been told to report to Team 1 but she sent us to radiology. The receptionist in radiology asked if a canula had been fitted we said no so she said go back to Team 1. We did this and the team 1 receptionist said that we had to be triaged at A&E so that they could confirm that a canula was required. We went back to radiology and the receptionist then personally took us back to team 1 and explained that the nurses in room 16 normally inserted canulas. the Team 1 receptionist said that they were busy but the Radiology receptionist took us to room 16 anyway where there were 2 nurses with no patients and these 2 very efficiently inserted the canula and we were back at Radiology in a few minutes. The "jobsworth" attitude of the Team 1 receptionist was adding triage workload to the A&E department and delaying treatment. The hospital has enough work with out more being added on by administrative incompetence.


While waiting to be triaged I watched a cleaner remove a single use plastic waste bag from a litter bin. He secured the bag with a single use plastic tie and then replaced the bag with 2 single use bags. The use of plastic in this way is not sustainable.

We went to treatment room 1 in majors and the tap was not turned off correctly because the positioning of the arms meant it fouled the duct panel at the rear. My daughter, who was with me said that she had been in the same room 2+ years ago and the problem was apparent then. Assuming it started at that point my calculation is that this represents the water from half an Olympic sized swimming pool which has been wasted. The financial cost will be about £2,000 but it is an unsustainable environmental cost. How many other similar taps are there in the hospital?

Good feedback would be somebody coming back to me to say that the tap has been fixed, all other taps have been checked and plastic use is being reduced. .

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Lack of care
body:
Telephone appt in April after many emails from my GP requesting the CMHT help me (supposedly a patient but have had patchy, if any care with six months or more at a time silence). Been told by CMHT I was on a waiting list for psychologist for 2 years.
Psychiatrist diagnosed cPTSD, partly as a result of lack of care when I suffered PND and the perinatal team discharging me regardless in 2018. The begging for support and never being phoned back in 2017/2018 lead in part to this cPTSD, and then I begged for some support during this April phone call and the psychiatrist advised I definitely needed support. 
Haven't heard a word from them since, despite my GP emailing them on my behalf frequently.

title: Awful service, avoid if you can!
body: Rude staff manning the telephones that seem to not want to help you in the slightest and make everything as difficult as possible. It would be easier to get an appointment for tea with the Queen than a GP or Nurse at this surgery. So many hoops to jump through. The GPs/Nurses when you are allowed to see them have always been fine and helpful - it's the admin and the pre-amble that is dreadful. Myself and my family have finally had enough of their incompetence and will be registering elsewhere.

title: Great practice
body:
Very
 Good service staff always very helpful
And polite a very pleasant atmosphere
In  very trying times.

title: 5 Star
body: The consultant was extremely pleasant and clear to understand.  The whole place to well run with COVID regulations in place to make patients feel safe.

title: lost for words
body:
the health care practice has gone from bad to worse and with the addition of covid which is being used as a means to avoid helping people calls to the number are not answered and often don't go through at all and even when visiting the practice to see a doctor you are told to call in which is frustrating as no one answers or the call system just does not connect this is not the 1st time an seems to be an ongoing issue with no real resolution when attending other than  being told to call 111 the practice offers a service which it is not delivering the practice was empty and still told no one had time to check my back pain after walking to the practice with great discomfort 

How can you say there is no go available when you have not even taken my name?
How do you know who my GP is without taking any information other than asking what's wrong with me?
How can you check anything if you have not even typed a letter into the keyboard?
can you stop using covid as a means not to give attendees to the practice help they need also if the walk-in aspect of this practice is no longer available can this be updated on your website as well as the NHS one as the information is misleading to think I had to call 111 for them to contact the same place I just came from for them to get the Gp to call me back at 1 pm  where is the logic in this please explain

title: Infuriating and upsetting
body:
I have been dealing with this practice for over 15 years in support of my elderly mother. At first the service was acceptable, sometimes very good, and there have been occasional instances of individuals being extra helpful and kind.  However, in recent years there has been a clear and obvious decline in the standard of service offered, starting well before the current covid crisis.  I see from other reviews that this is not a unique observation, and also that the response to criticism from the practice manager is defensive, patronising and authoritarian.  

Today I tried to book an appointment for a doctor to help my mother, who has multiple health issues, including dementia, heart disease, profound deafness, and mobility problems, and it was impossible because all triage appointments for the day had been filled.  The only alternatives offered were to try a local pharmacy, a drop-in centre, use Livi, or consult online web pages.   I am curious to know which of these options would suit my very frail, very confused, wheelchair using mother.  I do not live in the area, which means I cannot offer personal help, and her carer does not drive or use anything other than basic technology.  The final alternative is to try again tomorrow.  So, like peasants clamouring at a gate for charity I am expected to join the scramble every day to access a service for which my mother has paid during a long working life.  You have previously said that one of the reasons for making changes to the way we access services is so that reception staff will be able to deal more quickly with those people who have difficulties using the online systems.  If this was the goal, it has been an abject failure.  I cannot message you, I cannot book an appointment, and nobody ever seems to answer the phone. My own surgery has provided exemplary levels of care with scarcely any deterioration of speed or accessibility throughout the pandemic.  

Shepperton practice manager is often at pains to tell us that general practice is changing and is clearly frustrated that we are apparently unable to accept that change.  It would be more useful if the practice would accept firstly that few people resent change for the better, and ask why so many people would take the trouble to tell you repeatedly that your systems are not working, and fall below the standard available elsewhere.  At present your surgery is in effect closed, apart from a tiny window each day when we fight to get your attention.  Your website is cluttered, unfriendly, dictatorial and not intuitive to use. It seems to be constructed specifically to prevent access to services for most people. Even your telephone answering system sounds stern and unfriendly.

Like most people, I am a fierce advocate of the NHS and most of the people who work within it, but this general practice is increasingly failing to offer the level of compassion,  support and effectiveness  we have a right to expect.

title: Efficient and friendly
body:
I needed an urgent appointment with a GP last week. My call was answered within a couple of rings and the receptionist arranged a call back from a GP for later in the day. A GP rung within the specified time window. He sorted a referral for me. A secretary rung me later on the same day to confirm the details of my appointment at the hospital. Everyone was very friendly, helpful and efficient.
I have only recently registered with the surgery, but I am very pleased so far.

title: Worst GP ever
body:
This is one of worst GP ever i came across. 
Never they responds to calls, you have to keep ringing 100 times to get through somebody to just book an appointment or online consultation.  There has been numerous reviews on google and NHS site regarding this GP as how unsatisfied the patients are, has there any actions/measures taken to address it ?

title: such lovely staff
body: My 89 YO mum is currently an inpatient after being admitted following a fall and head injury last week. I am in London and am constantly phoning for updates. I have been treated with helpfulness, patience, kindness and understanding. Everyone I have spoken to has given me their time in an unhurried manner. I know the stress this (and every) hospital is currently under due to the pandemic and NHS cuts but I was never made to feel that I was being a pain. Thank you to everyone, particularly the Acute Assessment Unit, for making this horrible stressful experience that bit more bearable. You are amazing.

title: Such care
body: An unexpected visit to Barnstaple hospital left me in awe of the wonderful care I received. These nurses are just awesome.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appointments
body: Surgery rings to say a Doctor want to discuss blood test results.  Make an appointment.  So start at 8:30AM until 10:00AM.  Line busy.  Made 73 calls.  At 11:00Am, rang surgery.  Try next day again. And go into a loop.  They know the system is not working, but still demands to adhere to it.  Pathetic.  If nurses can see you face to face, why can't doctors.

title: great practice
body:
my daughter has serious chronic health problems necessitating frequent contact with the surgery. myself and my partner are also patients there.
I can't speak highly enough about all of the receptionists. They are all so friendly and helpful , it really helps me deal with the stress of my daughter's illness.
I'd also like to praise the GP's for their hard work and dedication.  All of the nursing staff are very caring and helpful. The health visitors are hard working professionals. 
Finally the practice manager goes out of his way to be helpful and caring.

title: Extremely poor administration
body: Doctors and nurses brilliant. Administration diabolical. I mean diabolical. Have to consider moving practice which I don't want to do.

title: Always helpful
body: I have been with this practice for 49 years and always had good service. They have handled the pandemic very well and it has always been possible to see someone face to face if necessary. Everyone is helpful and very nice.
